name: Meat Loaf
instructions: Mix all meat loaf ingredients well and pack into well-greased loaf pan. Mix sauce ingredients together and pour over meat loaf mixture. Bake 1 hour at 350 degrees.

name: Scalloped Potatoes
instructions:
Preheat oven to 375F.

Peel 4 or 5 medium potatoes to make 4 cups. Combine four, salt and pepper. Have the onions, butter and hot milk ready.
Arrange alternate layers of potatoes, onions and seasoned flour in a greased 2 quart (2 litre) casserole. Dot with butter

Pour hot milk over top and sprinkle with paprika.

Bake, covered, in preheated oven for 45 minutes. UNcover and backe for 15 minutes longer or until potatoes are tender and top lightly browned.

If desired, arrange 2 cups diced, cooked ham between layers

name: Turkey Lurkey
instructions:
Thaw turkey. Remove any extras from neck and body cavities. Wash turkey well inside and out with water. Stuff cavities with lots of paper towels and pat dry on outside. Allow to sit on more paper towels while you prepare the dressing.

REmove paper towels from cavities! Stuff body cavity. If you have pushed the tail out while washing the turkey, don't forget to put it back through the hole. Place skewers through top and bottom edges of the cavity opening (with the pointed ends down). Lace up the opening using heavy twine. Tie the legs together well. TUrn the turkey over and stuff the neck cavity. Secure flap with a skewer. Tie the wings to the body by placing a piece of twine all around the chest.

Grease the turkey from top to bottom with melted butter(use your hands!) Sprinkle the front of the turkey with salt and pepper and place breast down on a greased v-ed rack. Sprinkle back with salt and pepper. Make a v-ed tent with aluminum foil and place over back of turkey

Cook in preheated oven at 375F for 20-25 minutes per pound depending on the size of the bird. The bigger the turkey, the less time it takes per pound.

About an hour and half before it's done, remove turkey from oven, take off the foil and turn it breast side up (if you are cooking a smaller turkey, you would turn it over later i.e. about an hour before it's done). Cover drumsticks and neck with foil but leave the breast uncovered. Baste with sauce from pan and return to oven. Baste every fifteen minutes of so. It's done when you can move the drumstick easily up and down.

name: Bread Dressing
instructions: Toss to mix and stuff turkey. This makes enough to stuff 4-5 lb chiken. Double, Triple, etc.. as necessasry fro turkey.

name: Gravy
instructions:
Remove the fat from the top of the drippings by tipping the pan and spooning it off.This is a little tedious, but necessary.

Add enough water to give you the amount of gravy you want. Be careful you don't water it down too much. You can tell by the colur.

Put pan, with drippings, on stove and bring to a boil. Add salt and pepper to taste.

Mix either corn starch or flour with enoughwater to make it thick but runny. You'll need approximately 3 heaping soup spoons of corn staarch or 4 of the flour.If you're using corn starch, you can mix it with a spoon. If you're using flour, it mixes better if you shake it in a jar with a lid. Gradually add the mixture to the drippings in the pan, stirring constantly and rapidly with a wire whip. You may not need to use it all or you may need a little more. The corn starch rarely lumps, but you have to be quite careful if you are using flour. If your gravy does lump, just pour it through a sieve. When the gravy is the right consistency, turn the heat down to low and cook a few minutes more, stirring frequently.

ingredients.name: turkey
ingredients.preparation: drippings from (can also be from a roast)

name: Beet Stew
instructions:
Thoroughly brown meat on all sides in hot oil, turning often. Add water, lemon juice, Worcestershire sauce, whole garlic, sliced onion, bay leaves, and seasonings. Cover an simmer (don't boil) for 2 hours, stirring occasionally to keep from sticking. REmove bay leaves and garlic.

Add cut up vegetables (you can use anything you like). Cover and cook for about 30 minutes or until vegetables are done. Thicken with corn starch mixed in water and serve.

name: chile con carne
instructions: Fry meat and half the onion (diced) until brown. SPrinkle with salt. Add tomatoes (with juice), tomato soup, hlaf the diced onion and diced green pepper. Simmer until onion and pepper are cooked. Add beans (juice, too) and stir, adding salt and chili powder. Simmer at least 20 minutes

name: Moffatt Seafood Chowder
instructions:
If fish is frozen-thaw.

In large pan, cook onion in margarine until tender but not brown. Add cubed potatoes, water, fish and sprinkle with salt and pepper. Bring to boil and cook over low heat until potatoes are tender and fish flakes easily...about 15-20 minutes. Stir gently to break fish into bite size pieces. Combine milk and evaporated milk. Stir into flour until smooth and add all to fish.Cook over low until heated through. DON'T BOIL!

name: baked pork chops
instructions: Dredge pork chops in seasoned flour (or put flour in bag and shake with one or two pork chops at a time). Heat oil in frying pan. Brown pork chops on both sides. Place in casserole dish and top each chop with lemon slice (or use a tsp of lemon juice). Combine ketchup, water and brown sugar. Pour mixture around chops. Cover and bake in 350 degree oven for 30 minutes. Uncover and bake for 20 to 30 minutes more.

ingredients.name: seasoned flour
ingredients.prepartaion: flour with salt, pepper, paprika, and celery seed

name: wiener bean pot
instructions: Combine ingredients in greased 2 quart casserole dish or bean pot. Bake uncovered at 350 degrees about 1 hour

name: lasagna
instructions:
Brown meat slowly; spoon off excess fat. Add next 6 ingredients. Simmer uncovered 30 minutes to blend flavours, stirring occasionally.

Cook noodles in boiling salted water until tender. Drain and rinse in cold water. Meanwhile, combine cottage cheese with eggs, seasonings and Parmesan cheese.

Place half the noodles in a greases 9x13" pan. SPread half the cottage cheese mixture over. Add half the mozzarella cheese and half the meat sauce. REpeat layers.

Bake at 375F degree for 30 minutes. Garnish with triangles of Mozzarella cheese. Let stand 10 to 15 minutes before cutting in squares...filling will set slightly.

name: Dad's Caesar Salad
instructions:
Wash lettuce. Roll in paper towels or clean dish towel and cool in fridge. Break up by hand.

Min anchovies and garlic in bottom of large (preferably wooden) salad bowl. Add oil, lemon juice, egg yolk, salt nd pepper to taste, 2 tbsp of the parmesan cheese, dry mustard and tobasco. Mix well. Add lettuce and toss to coat lettuce. Top with 4 tbsp parmesan cheese and croutons.
